Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2012 07:24PM kpannabecker wrote: I just laughed as I read the heading I wrote for this original post.   HA!  I don't feel quite like that tonight.  Funny how emotions change so quickly.  Today I had my diagnostic mammogram and I was so impressed with the radiologist.  Talk about thorough!  I got called back in 3 times for more and more pictures.  Next I had an ultrasound and she even wanted to check lumps other drs told me were nothing.  She covered a lot of ground.  I was there 3 hours.  In the end there was still just the one lump that is a bit suspicious though she said with my lumpy breasts it's very likely just another cyst but will need a core needle biopsy to know for sure which will be sometime next week, I don't know the day yet.  At least this wait isn't as long as the others.  Thanks for the support.  I'll let you know how the biopsy goes.
Posts.Title: Have myself convinced I have cancer kpannabecker JanetM

Posts.Content: Dec 17, 2012 02:10PM kpannabecker wrote: I went for a biopsy today and they were able to aspirate the lump so, Merry Christmas to me.  It was just a cyst.
Posts.Title: Have myself convinced I have cancer kpannabecker JanetM

Posts.Content: Dec 17, 2012 08:19PM kpannabecker wrote: Thanks.  I'm feeling pretty darn good tonight.  It's amazing how good (or bad) a needle can make you feel.
Posts.Title: Have myself convinced I have cancer kpannabecker JanetM

Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2012 01:39PM kpannabecker wrote: Thanks everyone.  I don't feel like I'm panicked yet, though it does seem like I'm always real cool after I see a doctor and then as time progresses and I have another appointment approach I get more and more antsy.  I'm glad to hear many of you had to wait a good while for tests too and all went fine.  Also, DC197, I like your remark that if it is cancer it has probably been growing for a long time and a little more time isn't going to change much.  Staying busy is definitely the way to go.  I raise farm animals (dairy goats, pigs, donkeys, chickens, etc) and there's nothing more relaxing, than watching them and letting them entertain me.  I'm getting ready to head out on a hike with my husband now, which is also a good way to spend time.  I appreciate the comments.  Only 8 days till the next mammogram, but who's counting :)
Posts.Title: Have myself convinced I have cancer kpannabecker JanetM
